uk.ac.cam.cl.juliet.slave.xdpprocessing.Packets

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.cl.juliet.slave.xdpprocessing.Packets.DataWrapper
      • uk.ac.cam.cl.juliet.slave.xdpprocessing.Packets.Packet

  • public class Packet
extends DataWrapper
    This class encapsulates an XDP packet that consists of a byte array of data. The first bytes form a header and this class provides getter-functions to return the header fields. The underlying method from the DataWrapper are used to read the body of the packet which contains at least one XDP message
    Author:
    Lucas Sonnabend
    See Also:
    DataWrapper, Message

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Packet(byte[] data)
      Create a packet object that wraps the data of a packet It will read the header of the packet from the data, the data pointer will then be at position 16 in the data array.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDeliveryFlag()
      Return the delivery flag of the packet
      Message getNextMessage()
      Read the next message within the data array This wraps the data into a Message object and returns the message object.
      int getNumberOfMsgs()
      Return the number of messages in this packet
      long getSequenceNumber()
      Return sequence number of this packet
      long getTimestamp()
      Return the send time (seconds since Unix Epoch) of this packet
      long getTimestampNS()
      Return the send time in nanoseconds of this packet

      • getNextMessage

        public Message getNextMessage()
        Read the next message within the data array This wraps the data into a Message object and returns the message object. The data pointer advances by the size of the next message
        Returns:
        the next message or null if you reached the end of the packet
